alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 4:29PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong ouflow wind from thunderstorms will impact portions of Carbon County through 500 PM MDT... At 429 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong outflow wind from thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Seminoe Dam to near Battle Lake. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rawlins, Saratoga, Hanna, Encampment, Baggs, Sinclair, Medicine Bow, Elk Mountain, Dixon, Battle Mountain, Grand Encampment, Battle Lake, Six Mile Campground, Muddy Gap, Haskins Creek Campground, Teton Reservoir, Seminoe Dam, Savery, Ryan Park Campground and Lost Creek Campground. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 200 and 279. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
